settings.security.certificates.description:
This dictionary provides the security settings for Pure Storage.

Optional fields are:
  * `directory_service` - LDAP Integration
  * `users` - Local Users
settings.security.certificates.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security

Imported Array Certificates.

Required fields are:
  * `certificate`
  * `name`
  * `private_key`

Optional fields are:
  * `intermediate_certificate`
  * `key_passphrase`
array_certificates.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Certificates > Array Certificates

certificate_groups.description:
Array Certificate Groups.

Required fields are:
  * `certificates`
  * `name`
certificate_groups.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Certificates > Certificate Groups

settings.security.certificates.array_cer.description:
Imported Array Certificates.

Required fields are:
  * `array_fqdns`
  * `certificate`
  * `name`
  * `private_key`

Optional fields are:
  * `intermediate_certificate`
  * `key_passphrase`
settings.security.certificates.array_cer.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Certificates > Array Certificates

array_fqdns.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name(s) of the storage array(s).

items.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name of the storage array.
items.title: Array Fully Qualified Domain Name

array_fqdns.title: Array Fully Qualified Domain Names

certificate.description: Default is `1`.  The Environment File location Variable of the signed certificate.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables cert_mgmt_certificate_[1-64].  i.e. `export cert_mgmt_certificate_1='/home/example/certificate.pem'`.  Verify the certificate is PEM formatted (Base64 encoded), include the " -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- " and " -----END CERTIFICATE----- " lines.
certificate.title: Certificate File Variable

intermediate_certificate.description: Default is `1`.  (Optional) The Environment File location Variable of the signed certificate.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables cert_mgmt_intermediate_certificate_[1-64].  i.e. `export cert_mgmt_intermediate_certificate_1='/home/example/certificate.pem'`.  Verify the certificate is PEM formatted (Base64 encoded), include the " -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- " and " -----END CERTIFICATE----- " lines.
intermediate_certificate.title: Intermediate Certificate File Variable

key_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  If the private key is encrypted with a passphrase, enter the passphrase.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables cert_mgmt_passphrase_[1-64].  i.e. `export cert_mgmt_passphrase_1='cisco123'`.
key_passphrase.title: Key Passphrase

private_key.description: Default is `1`.  The Environment File location Variable of the signed certificate.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables cert_mgmt_private_key_[1-64].  i.e. `export cert_mgmt_private_key_1='/home/example/certificate.pem'`.  Verify the certificate is PEM formatted (Base64 encoded), include the " -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- " and " -----END CERTIFICATE----- " lines.
private_key.title: Private Key File Variable

Array Certificate Groups.

  * `array_fqdns`
  * `certificates`

settings.security.certificates.certifica.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Certificates > Certificate Groups

certificates.description: List of Certificates to assign to the certificate group.
certificates.title: Certificates

Directory Service LDAP configurations.

Optional fields are:
  * `configuration`
  * `role_mappings`
settings.security.directory_service.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Directory Service

configuration.description:
Pure Storage Directory Service configuration settings.

Required fields are:
  * `base_dn`
  * `bind_password`
  * `bind_user`
  * `uri_list`

Optional fields are:
  * `ca_certificate`
  * `ca_certificate_group`
  * `enabled`
  * `type`
configuration.title: Pure Storage > Settings > Security > Directory Service > Configuration

role_mappings.description:
Pure Storage Directory Service Role Mappings.

Required fields are:
  * `end_point_role`
  * `group_dn`

Optional fields are:
  * `group`
role_mappings.title: Pure Storage > Settings > Security > Directory Service > Role Mappings

settings.security.directory_service.conf.description:
Pure Storage Directory Service configuration settings.

Required fields are:
  * `base_dn`
  * `bind_password`
  * `bind_user`
  * `uri_list`

Optional fields are:
  * `ca_certificate`
  * `ca_certificate_group`
  * `enabled`
  * `type`
settings.security.directory_service.conf.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Directory Service > Configuration

base_dn.description: Base Distinguished Name (DN). Starting point from where server will search for users and groups.
base_dn.title: Base Distinguished Name

bind_password.description: Default is `1`.  The LDAP Binding Password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables ldap_bind_password_[1-64].  i.e. `export ldap_bind_password_1='cisco123'`.
bind_password.title: Bind Password

bind_user.description: Distinguished Name (DN) of the user, that is used to authenticate against LDAP servers.
bind_user.title: Bind Username

ca_certificate.description: The Name of the CA Certificate, configured under SECURITY > Certificates for FlashBlade.  For FlashArray.
ca_certificate.title: CA Certificate

ca_certificate_group.description: The Name of the CA Certificate Group, configured under SECURITY > Certificates.
ca_certificate_group.title: CA Certificate Group

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enable Management Directory Service.
enabled.title: Enable Directory Service

type.description: Default is `management`.  The type of directory service configuration. FlashArray supports `data` and `management`.  FlashBlade supports `management`, `nfs`, and `smb`.
type.title: Directory Service Type

uri_list.description: List of LDAP Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) to connect to.

items.description:
Each URI must include the scheme ldap:// or ldaps:// (for LDAP over SSL), a hostname, and a domain name or IP address. For example, ldap://ad.company.com configures the directory service with the hostname "ad" in the domain "company.com" while specifying the unencrypted LDAP protocol.

We highly recommend either configuring StartTLS by enabling a certificate or certificate group, or configuring URIs by using the ldaps:// scheme to use LDAP over SSL, unless there is no need for secure communication in your environment.

If specifying a domain name, it should be resolvable by the configured DNS servers.

If specifying an IP address, for IPv4, specify the IP address in the form ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd, where ddd is a number ranging from 0 to 255 representing a group of 8 bits.

For IPv6, specify the IP address in the form [xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx], where xxxx is a hexadecimal number representing a group of 16 bits. Enclose the entire address in square brackets ( []) . Consecutive fields of zeros can be shortened by replacing the zeros with a double colon ( ::).

If the base DN is not configured and a URI is provided, the base DN will automatically default to the domain components of the URIs.

Optionally specify a port. Append the port number after the end of the entire address. Default ports are 389 for LDAP, and 636 for LDAPS. Non-standard ports can be specified in the URI if they are in use.
items.title: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI)

uri_list.title: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) List

user_login_attribute.description: Default is `sAMAccountName`.  The value of the User Login Attribute. The User Login Attribute defaults to the sAMAccountName for Active Directory, or UID for other server types.
user_login_attribute.title: User Login Attribute

user_object_class.description: Default is `User`.  The value of the User Object Class. The User Object Class defaults to User for AD, posixAccount or shadowAccount for OpenLDAP depending on the server's schema, posixAccount for posix-compliant servers, or person for all other server types.
user_object_class.title: User Object Class

settings.security.directory_service.role.description:
Directory Service Role Mappings.

Required fields are:
  * `end_point_role`
  * `group_dn`
  * `name`

Optional fields are:
  * `group`
settings.security.directory_service.role.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Directory Service > Role Mappings

group.description: In the Group field, enter the common name (CN) of the directory group. The name should be the Common Name of the group without the "CN=" specifier. If the configured groups are not in the same OU, also specify the OU. For example, "pureusers,OU=PureStorage", where pureusers is the common name of the directory service group.
group.title: Group Common Name

group_base.description: In the Group Base field, enter the path to the configured groups in the directory tree. The Group Base consists of one or more path components (OUs and CNs) that, when combined with the base DN attribute and the configured group CNs, complete the full distinguished name of each group. The group base should specify “OU=” for each OU and “CN=” for each CN. Multiple path components should be separated by commas. The order of the path components should get larger in scope from left to right. In the following example, SANManagers contains the sub-organizational unit PureGroups: “OU=PureGroups,OU=SANManagers”.
group_base.title: Group Distinguished Name

role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  Select a role from the Role list.
  * `array_admin`
  * `ops_admin`
  * `readonly`
  * `storage_admin`
role.title: Endpoint Role

Requires one of the following fields are:

  * `ca_certificate_group`
  * `enabled`
settings.security.single_sign_on.oidc_id.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Single Sign-On > OIDC Identity Providers

ca_certificate.description: The Name of the CA Certificate, configured under SECURITY > Certificates.
ca_certificate.title: CA Certificate

ca_certificate_group.description: The Name of the CA Certificate Group, configured under SECURITY > Certificates.
ca_certificate_group.title: CA Certificate Group

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enable SAML Identity Provider.

settings.security.single_sign_on.saml_id.description:

  * `provider_url`

Requires one of the following fields are:

  * `ca_certificate_group`

settings.security.single_sign_on.saml_id.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Single Sign-On > SAML Identity Providers

enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Enable SAML Identity Provider.
enabled.title: Enable SAML Identity Provider

idp_metadata_ca_certificate.description: (Optional) In the IdP Metadata CA Certificate field, enter the CA certificate name to validate the authenticity of the IdP metadata file.
idp_metadata_ca_certificate.title: IdP Metadata CA Certificate

idp_metadata_ca_certificate_group.description: (Optional) In the IdP Metadata CA Certificate Group field, enter the name of the group of CA of certificates to validate the authenticity of the IdP metadata file.
idp_metadata_ca_certificate_group.title: IdP Metadata CA Certificate Group

idp_verification_certificate.description:
In the IdP Verification Certificate field, enter the name of the certificate used by the SP to verify the signed SAML response from the IdP. This is required if the IdP metadata URL is not provided.

Used by service provider (SP) to verify the signed SAML response from IdP.
idp_verification_certificate.title: IdP Verification Certificate

settings.security.users.description:
Endpoint User or Local User.

Required fields are:
  * `name`
  * `password`
  * `role`

Optional fields are:
  * `api_token`
settings.security.users.title: Pure Storage - Settings > Security > Users

name.description: The user name.  The user pureuser is not allowed, due to the script deleting and re-adding the user.
name.title: Username

password.description: Default is `1`.  The local user password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables local_user_password_[1-64].  i.e. `export local_user_password_1='cisco123'`.  If value is `0`, script will generate random password.
password.title: User Password

role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  Select a role from the Role list.

  * `readonly`
  * `storage_admin`
role.title: Endpoint Role

v2c.description:
List of SNMP Manager connections.

Required fields are:
 * `community`
  * `name`
  * `host`

Optional fields are:
  * `port`
  * `snmp_notification`
v2c.title: Version 2c SNMP Managers

v3.description:
List of SNMP Manager connections.

Required fields are:
  * `name`
  * `host`
 * `user`

Optional fields are:
  * `auth_protocol`
  * `auth_passphrase`
  * `port`
  * `privacy_protocol`
  * `privacy_passphrase`
  * `snmp_notification`
  * `user`
v3.title: Version 3 SNMP Managers

settings.system.monitoring.snmp.add_snmp.description:
List of SNMP Manager connections.

Required fields are:
 * `community`
  * `name`
  * `host`

Optional fields are:
  * `port`
  * `snmp_notification`
settings.system.monitoring.snmp.add_snmp.title: Pure Storage - Version 2c SNMP Managers

community.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_community_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_community_1='cisco123'`.
community.title: Community String Number

host.description: Hostname/Address to which the SNMP trap information is sent.
host.title: host

port.description: Default is `162`.  Port used by the server to communicate with the trap destination. Enter a value between 1-65535. Reserved ports not allowed (22, 23, 80, 123, 389, 443, 623, 636, 2068, 3268, 3269).
port.title: SNMP Port

snmp_notification.description:
Default is `trap`.  Type of trap which decides whether to receive a notification when a trap is received at the destination.
  * `inform` - Receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination. This option is valid only for V2 users.
  * `trap` - Do not receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination.
snmp_notification.title: Snmp Notification

settings.system.monitoring.snmp.add_snmp.description:
List of SNMP Manager connections.

Required fields are:
  * `name`
  * `host`
 * `user`

Optional fields are:
  * `auth_protocol`
  * `auth_passphrase`
  * `port`
  * `privacy_protocol`
  * `privacy_passphrase`
  * `snmp_notification`
  * `user`
settings.system.monitoring.snmp.add_snmp.title: Pure Storage - Version 3 SNMP Managers

auth_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_auth_passphrase_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_auth_passphrase_1='cisco123'`.
auth_passphrase.title: Authentication Passphrase number

auth_protocol.description:
Default is `SHA`.  Hash algorithm for the user.
  * `None` - Hash algorithm is not applicable.
  * `MD5` - MD5 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * `SHA` - SHA protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
auth_protocol.title: Auth Protocol / Hash Algorithm

host.description: Address to which the SNMP trap information is sent.
host.title: host

port.description: Default is `162`.  Port used by the server to communicate with the trap destination. Enter a value between 1-65535. Reserved ports not allowed (22, 23, 80, 123, 389, 443, 623, 636, 2068, 3268, 3269).
port.title: SNMP Port

privacy_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_privacy_passphrase_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_privacy_passphrase_1='cisco123'`.
privacy_passphrase.title: Privacy Passphrase number

privacy_protocol.description:
Default is `SHA`.  Encryption protocol for authenticating the user.
  * `None` - Encryption protocol is not applicable.
  * `DES` - DES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
  * `AES` - AES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
privacy_protocol.title: Privacy Protocol

snmp_notification.description:
Default is `trap`.  Type of trap which decides whether to receive a notification when a trap is received at the destination.
  * `inform` - Receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination. This option is valid only for V2 users.
  * `trap` - Do not receive notifications when trap is sent to the destination.
snmp_notification.title: Snmp Notification

settings.system.monitoring.snmp.edit_snm.description:
Local SNMP Agent settings for Pure Storage.

Optional fields are:
  * `auth_passphrase`
  * `auth_protocol`
  * `privacy_passphrase`
  * `privacy_protocol`
  * `user`
settings.system.monitoring.snmp.edit_snm.title: Pure Storage - Local SNMP Agent

auth_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_auth_passphrase_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_auth_passphrase_1='cisco123'`.
auth_passphrase.title: Authentication Passphrase number

auth_protocol.description:
Default is `SHA`.  Hash algorithm for the user.
  * `None` - Hash algorithm is not applicable.
  * `MD5` - MD5 protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
  * `SHA` - SHA protocol is used to authenticate SNMP user.
auth_protocol.title: Auth Protocol / Hash Algorithm

community.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_community_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_community_1='cisco123'`.
community.title: Community String Number

privacy_passphrase.description: Default is `1`.  A number Between 1-64 to denote to use one of the variables snmp_privacy_passphrase_[1-64].  i.e. `export snmp_privacy_passphrase_1='cisco123'`.
privacy_passphrase.title: Privacy Passphrase number

privacy_protocol.description:
Default is `SHA`.  Encryption protocol for authenticating the user.
  * `None` - Encryption protocol is not applicable.
  * `DES` - DES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
  * `AES` - AES privacy protocol is used for SNMP user.
privacy_protocol.title: Privacy Protocol

snmp_version.description: Default is `3`.  SNMP version to use for the connection.
snmp_version.title: SNMP Version

user.description: SNMP username. Must have a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 31 characters.  Cannot be `admin`.
user.title: SNMP Username

settings.system.monitoring.syslog_server.description:
Syslog Server Connection settings for Pure Storage.

Required fields are:
  * `name`
  * `services`
  * `uri`
settings.system.monitoring.syslog_server.title: Syslog Server Connections

name.description: Name of the Syslog Server Connection.
name.title: Name of the Syslog Server Connection

services.description: Services to send to the syslog server connection.
services.title: Services

uri.description:
Enter the URI of the remote syslog server.
Specify the URI in the format PROTOCOL://HOSTNAME:PORT, where
PROTOCOL is TCP, TLS, or UDP.
Note that when establishing TLS communication, the syslog server must be configured with either a CA certificate or CA certificate group (for multiple remote syslog servers). See Selecting CA Certificates for Syslog Server Connections. Additionally, your firewall must be set to allow in-bound and out-bound traffic.

HOSTNAME is the syslog server's hostname or IP address. If specifying an IP address, for IPv4, specify the IP address in the form ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd, where ddd is a number ranging from 0 to 255 representing a group of 8 bits.
For IPv6, specify the IP address in the form [xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx], where xxxx is a hexadecimal number representing a group of 16 bits. Enclose the entire address in square brackets ([]). Consecutive fields of zeros can be shortened by replacing the zeros with a double colon (::).

PORT is the port at which the server is listening. Append the port number after the end of the entire address. This is optional if the standard port number 514 for UDP or TCP, or the standard port number 6514 for TLS, is used.
uri.title: URI

settings.system.support.description:
The support settings for the Pure Storage arrays.

Required fields are:
  * `phone_home_enabled`

Optional fields are:
  * `proxy_server`
  * `remote_assist_connected`
settings.system.support.title: Support settings for the Pure Storage arrays

phone_home_enabled.description: Default is `true`.  Flag to tell the script to enable Phone Home support.
phone_home_enabled.title: Phone Home Enabled

proxy_server.description:
The Proxy Server to use for the arrays.

This is optional, but if you have a proxy server, you can set it here.
proxy_server.title: Proxy Server

remote_assist_connected.description: Default is `24`.  Length of time to enable the Remote Assistance.
remote_assist_connected.title: Remote Assist Enabled

shared_settings.description:
Settings to apply to the C885A Hosts.

Optional fields are:
  * `bios`
  * `boot_order`
  * `device_connector`
  * `ethernet_interfaces`
  * `ldap`
  * `local_user`
  * `ntp`
  * `proxy_settings`
shared_settings.title: UCS - Platform Settings

boot_order.description: Default is `true`.  Flag to tell script to configure boot order on the system.
boot_order.title: System Boot Order

local_user.description: List of local users to create on the system.
local_user.title: Local Users

shared_settings.bios.description:
A BIOS policy automates the configuration of BIOS settings on servers.

Required fields are:
  * `cbs_cmn_apbdis`
  * `cbs_cmn_cpu_global_cstate_ctrl`
  * `cbs_cmn_determinism_enable`
  * `cbs_cmn_gnb_nb_iommu`
  * `cbs_cmn_gnb_smu_df_cstates_rs`
  * `cbs_cpu_smt_ctrl`
  * `cbs_df_cmn_dram_nps`
  * `sha384pcr_bank`
  * `terminal_type`
shared_settings.bios.title: UCS - BIOS Settings

cbs_cmn_apbdis.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting APBDIS configuration.
   *  0 - Value - 0 for configuring CbsCmnApbdis token.
   *  1 - Value - 1 for configuring CbsCmnApbdis token.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsCmnApbdis token.
cbs_cmn_apbdis.title: cbs_cmn_apbdis

cbs_cmn_cpu_global_cstate_ctrl.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting Global C State Control configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsCmnCpuGlobalCstateCtrl token.
   *  Disabled - Value - disabled for configuring CbsCmnCpuGlobalCstateCtrl token.
   *  Enabled - Value - enabled for configuring CbsCmnCpuGlobalCstateCtrl token.
cbs_cmn_cpu_global_cstate_ctrl.title: cbs_cmn_cpu_global_cstate_ctrl

cbs_cmn_determinism_enable.description:
Default is `Power`.  BIOS Token for setting Determinism Slider configuration.
   *  Performance - Value - Performance for configuring CbsCmnDeterminismEnable token.
   *  Power - Value - Power for configuring CbsCmnDeterminismEnable token.
cbs_cmn_determinism_enable.title: cbs_cmn_determinism_enable

cbs_cmn_gnb_nb_iommu.description:
Default is `platform-default`.  BIOS Token for setting IOMMU configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsCmnGnbNbIommu token.
   *  Disabled - Value - disabled for configuring CbsCmnGnbNbIommu token.
   *  Enabled - Value - enabled for configuring CbsCmnGnbNbIommu token.
cbs_cmn_gnb_nb_iommu.title: cbs_cmn_gnb_nb_iommu

cbs_cmn_gnb_smu_df_cstates_rs.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting DF C-States configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsCmnGnbSmuDfCstates token.
   *  Disabled - Value - disabled for configuring CbsCmnGnbSmuDfCstates token.
   *  Enabled - Value - enabled for configuring CbsCmnGnbSmuDfCstates token.
cbs_cmn_gnb_smu_df_cstates_rs.title: cbs_cmn_gnb_smu_df_cstates_rs

cbs_cpu_smt_ctrl.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting CPU SMT Mode configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsCpuSmtCtrl token.
   *  Disable - Value - disabled for configuring CbsCpuSmtCtrl token.
   *  Enable - Value - enabled for configuring CbsCpuSmtCtrl token.
cbs_cpu_smt_ctrl.title: cbs_cpu_smt_ctrl

cbs_df_cmn_dram_nps.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting NUMA Nodes per Socket configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsDfCmnDramNps token.
   *  NPS0 - Value - NPS0 for configuring CbsDfCmnDramNps token.
   *  NPS1 - Value - NPS1 for configuring CbsDfCmnDramNps token.
   *  NPS2 - Value - NPS2 for configuring CbsDfCmnDramNps token.
   *  NPS4 - Value - NPS4 for configuring CbsDfCmnDramNps token.
cbs_df_cmn_dram_nps.title: cbs_df_cmn_dram_nps

cbs_df_cmn_mem_intlv.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting AMD Memory Interleaving configuration.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsDfCmnMemIntlv token.
   *  Channel - Value - Channel for configuring CbsDfCmnMemIntlv token.
   *  Die - Value - Die for configuring CbsDfCmnMemIntlv token.
   *  None - Value - None for configuring CbsDfCmnMemIntlv token.
   *  Socket - Value - Socket for configuring CbsDfCmnMemIntlv token.
cbs_df_cmn_mem_intlv.title: cbs_df_cmn_mem_intlv

csb_df_cmn_3_link_max_xgmi_speed.description:
Default is `Auto`.  BIOS Token for setting AMD maximum XGMI Speed.
   *  Auto - Value - Auto for configuring CbsDfCmn3LinkMaxXgmiSpeed token.
   *  20Gbps - Value - Channel for configuring CbsDfCmn3LinkMaxXgmiSpeed token.
   *  25Gbps - Value - Die for configuring CbsDfCmn3LinkMaxXgmiSpeed token.
   *  32Gbps - Value - None for configuring CbsDfCmn3LinkMaxXgmiSpeed token.
csb_df_cmn_3_link_max_xgmi_speed.title: csb_df_cmn_3_link_max_xgmi_speed

sha384pcr_bank.description:
Default is `platform-default`.  BIOS Token for setting SHA384 PCR Bank configuration.
  * Disabled - Disables the BIOS setting.
  * Enabled - Enables the BIOS setting.
sha384pcr_bank.title: sha384pcr_bank

terminal_type.description:
Default is `VT-UTF8`.  BIOS Token for setting Terminal Type configuration.
   *  ANSI - Value - pc-ansi for configuring TerminalType token.
   *  VT100 - Value - vt100 for configuring TerminalType token.
   *  VT100Plus - Value - vt100-plus for configuring TerminalType token.
   *  VT-UTF8 - Value - vt-utf8 for configuring TerminalType token.
terminal_type.title: terminal_type

shared_settings.device_connector.description:
Intersight Settings to configure to register the device connector.

Required fields are:
  * `intersight`
shared_settings.device_connector.title: UCS - Device Connector Settings

shared_settings.device_connector.intersi.description:
Intersight Settings to configure to register the device connector.

Required fields are:
  * `organization`
  * `resource_group`
shared_settings.device_connector.intersi.title: UCS - Device Connector Settings

organization.description: Name of the Organization to assign to the server.
organization.title: organization

resource_group.description: Name of the Resource Group to assign to the server.
resource_group.title: resource_group

shared_settings.ethernet_interfaces.description:
BMC ethernet interface settings.

Required fields are:
  * `domain_name`
  * `dns_servers`
  * `ipv4`
shared_settings.ethernet_interfaces.title: UCS - Ethernet Interface Settings

dns_servers.description: List of DNS Servers to add to the servers.
dns_servers.title: DNS Servers

BMC ethernet interface IPv4 settings.

Required fields are:
  * `gateway`
  * `netmask`
shared_settings.ethernet_interfaces.ipv4.title: UCS - Ethenret IPv4 Settings

shared_settings.ldap.description:
BMC LDAP settings.

Required fields are:
  * `base_settings`
  * `binding_parameters`
  * `search_parameters`

Optional fields are:
  * `ldap_groups`
  * `ldap_servers`
shared_settings.ldap.title: UCS - Ethernet Interface Settings

ldap_groups.description:
A List of LDAP Groups.

Required Attributes:
  * end_point_role
  * group_dn
ldap_groups.title: ldap_groups - LDAP Groups

ldap_servers.description:
A List of LDAP Provider Servers.

Required Attributes:
  * server

Optional Attributes:
  * port
  * vendor
ldap_servers.title: ldap_servers - LDAP Provider Servers

shared_settings.ldap.base_settings.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.
  * Required Attributes:
  * domain_name
shared_settings.ldap.base_settings.title: LDAP - Base Settings

domain_name.description: The LDAP domain that all users must be in.  An example would be `example.com`.
domain_name.title: Domain Name

shared_settings.ldap.binding_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP.

Required Attributes:
  * bind_dn
shared_settings.ldap.binding_parameters.title: LDAP - Binding Parameters

bind_dn.description: Base Distinguished Name (DN). Starting point from where server will search for users and groups.
bind_dn.title: Binding Distinguished Name

end_point_role.description:
Default is `ReadOnly`.  The name of the end point role.
  * Administrator
  * Operator
  * ReadOnly
end_point_role.title: Endpoint Role

group_dn.description:
LDAP Group DN in the LDAP server database.

This is the Distinguished Name (DN) of the LDAP group that will be used to assign permissions to the users in this group.
group_dn.title: group_dn

port.description: Default is `389`.  LDAP Server Port for connection establishment.
port.title: port

server.description: LDAP Server Address, can be IP address or hostname.
server.title: server

vendor.description:
Default is `OpenLDAP`.  LDAP server vendor type used for authentication.
  * `OpenLDAP` - Open source LDAP server for remote authentication.
  * `MSAD` - Microsoft active directory for remote authentication.
vendor.title: vendor

shared_settings.ldap.search_parameters.description:
Base settings of LDAP required while configuring LDAP policy.  Required Attributes:
  * user_attribute
  * group_attribute
shared_settings.ldap.search_parameters.title: search_parameters

group_attribute.description: Default is `memberOf`.  Attribute that identifies the Groups to which an LDAP user belongs.
group_attribute.title: group_attribute

user_attribute.description: Default is `sAMAccountName`.  Criteria to identify entries in search requests.
user_attribute.title: User Attribute Filter

shared_settings.local_user.description:
Endpoint User or Local User.

Required fields are:
  * `password`
  * `role`
  * `username`

Optional fields are:
  * `enabled`
shared_settings.local_user.title: UCS - Local User Settings

enabled.description: Flag to enable or disable the user.

password.description: Default is `1`.  The local user password Sensitive Variable Identifier.  A number Between 1-64 to denote the variables local_user_password_[1-64].  i.e. `export local_user_password_1='cisco123'`.
password.title: User Password

role.description:
Default is `readonly`.  Select a role from the Role list.
  * `array_admin`
  * `ops_admin`
  * `readonly`
  * `storage_admin`
role.title: Endpoint Role

shared_settings.ntp.description:
BMC ethernet interface IPv4 settings.

Required fields are:
  * `ntp_servers`
  * `timezone`
shared_settings.ntp.title: UCS - NTP Settings

ntp_servers.description: List of NTP Servers to Assign to the Policy.

shared_settings.proxy_settings.description:
BMC ethernet interface IPv4 settings.

Required fields are:
  * `proxy_hostname`
  * `proxy_port`
shared_settings.proxy_settings.title: UCS - Device Connector Proxy Settings
